metadata.title: CVE-2023-44452 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Linux Mint Xreader CBT File Parsing Argument Injection Remote CodeExecution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code on affected installations of Linux Mint Xreader.User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that thetarget must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specificflaw exists within the parsing of CBT files. The issue results from thelack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it toexecute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability toexecute code in the context of the current user. Was ZDI-CAN-22132.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
